meanings.sent1: After the earthquake, we needed to rebalance the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: I like to rebalance my bike tires every few months to keep them in good shape.
meanings.sent3: The seesaw refused to rebalance until the kids stopped jumping off it.
meanings.sent4: She tried to rebalance her workload, but it felt like juggling too many balls at once.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew he had to rebalance the flavors in the soup to make it perfect.

meanings.definition: To adjust or readjust the balance of something.
meanings.sent1: Please rebalance the weights on the scale to get an accurate measurement.
meanings.sent2: It's important to rebalance your investment portfolio regularly to manage risk.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to rebalance itself on the narrow ledge but ended up falling off.
meanings.sent4: The dancer had to rebalance her stance to perform the difficult move gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helped the student rebalance the equation to solve the math problem.

meanings.definition: To bring something back into balance.
meanings.sent1: The therapist helped her rebalance her emotions after a stressful week.
meanings.sent2: He needed to rebalance his diet by adding more fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to rebalance the spinning plates on sticks but they kept falling.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebalance her schedule to make time for both work and family.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor taught her students how to rebalance their bodies during the tree pose.
